src/gtrm.c

00001 /*
00002  * gtrm.c -- the body of the program.
00003  *
00004  *       The GNU trm program is a program which prints a random
00005  *       message when you run it. However, it supports options.
00006  *
00007  *       See Texinfo manual page for more information.
00008  *
00009  * Copyright (C) 2006 Efstathios Chatzikyriakidis (contact@efxa.org)
00010  *
00011  * This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
00012  * it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
00013  * the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or
00014  * (at your option) any later version.
00015  *
00016  * This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
00017  * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
00018  * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
00019  * GNU General Public License for more details.
00020  *
00021  * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
00022  * along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software

00027 /* standard includes. */
00028 #include <assert.h>
00029 #include <getopt.h>
00030 #include <stdio.h>
00031 #include <stdlib.h>
00032 #include <errno.h>
00033 #include <unistd.h>
00034 #include <error.h>
00035 
00036 /* my includes. */
00037 #include "program_typedefs.h"
00038 #include "program_structures.h"
00039 #include "program_messages.h"
00040 
00041 /* local defines. */
00042 #define MAX_LINE (1024 * 1024)  /* 1 Mbyte. */
00043 
00044 #define FILENAME_RANDOM ((high_randomness != false) ? "/dev/random"      : "/dev/urandom")
00045 #define FILENAME_IN     ((input_filename  == NULL)  ? environment_input  : input_filename)
00046 #define FILENAME_OUT    ((output_filename == NULL)  ? environment_output : output_filename)
00047 
00048 #define WRITE_DESTINATION  ((ofp != NULL) ? ofp : stdout)
00049 #define READ_SOURCE        ((ifp != NULL) ? ifp : stdin)
00050 
00051 /* global variables. */
00052 static const char *input_filename = NULL;
00053 static const char *output_filename = NULL;
00054 
00055 static const char *environment_input = NULL;
00056 static const char *environment_output = NULL;
00057 
00058 static const char *program_name = NULL;
00059 
00060 static bool verbose = false;
00061 static bool high_randomness = false;
00062 
00063 static long loop_min = 0;
00064 static long loop_max = 1;
00065 
00066 /* linked lists. */
00067 static LIST *list_a_ptr = NULL;
00068 
00069 /* externs. */
00070 extern int random_number (cint, cint, unique);
00071 extern LIST *init_list (void);
00072 extern void free_list (LIST *);
00073 extern bool enter (LIST *, unique, cint);
00074 extern void print_line (FILE *, LIST *, cint);
00075 extern char *strdup (const char *);
00076 
00077 /* the name of the executable only. */
00078 extern char *program_invocation_short_name;
00079 
00080 /* function prototypes. */
00081 static void parse_options (int, char **);
00082 static void print_usage (FILE *, cint);
00083 
00084 /* functions. */
00085 /* the body of the program. */
00086 int
00087 main (int argc, char **argv)
00088 {
00089   FILE *rfp = NULL;             /* randomness input file pointer. */
00090   FILE *ofp = NULL;             /* data output file pointer. */
00091   FILE *ifp = NULL;             /* data input file pointer. */
00092   bool enter_node = true;       /* state of entered new node. */
00093   int max_lines = 0;            /* max lines found in the input file. */
00094   int random_position = 0;      /* random position for the printing. */
00095   char sentence[MAX_LINE] = { 0 };      /* current line of chars. */
00096 
00097   /* parse all input command line options. */
00098   parse_options (argc, argv);
00099 
00100   /* if there are any input files print them. */
00101   if ((argc != optind) && verbose)
00102     {
00103       register int i, z;
00104 
00105       fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", useless_arguments);
00106       for (z = 1, i = optind; i < argc; ++z, ++i)
00107         fprintf (stderr, " (%d): `%s'\n", z, argv[i]);
00108 
00109       /* for the interface. */
00110       fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00111     }
00112 
00113   /* print some verbose messages. */
00114   if (high_randomness && verbose)
00115     fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", high_random_quality);
00116 
00117   if ((input_filename == NULL) && (environment_input != NULL) && verbose)
00118     fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", use_environment_input);
00119 
00120   if ((output_filename == NULL) && (environment_output != NULL) && verbose)
00121     fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", use_environment_output);
00122 
00123   /* open the randomness input file. */
00124   if ((rfp = fopen (FILENAME_RANDOM, "r")) == NULL)
00125     error (EXIT_FAILURE, errno, "%s `%s'", file_read_error, FILENAME_RANDOM);
00126   else
00127     {
00128       /* open the appropriate input file. */
00129       if ((input_filename != NULL) || (environment_input != NULL))
00130         if ((ifp = fopen (FILENAME_IN, "r")) == NULL)
00131           error (EXIT_FAILURE, errno, "%s `%s'", file_read_error,
00132                  FILENAME_IN);
00133 
00134       /* open the appropriate output file. */
00135       if ((output_filename != NULL) || (environment_output != NULL))
00136         if ((ofp = fopen (FILENAME_OUT, "w")) == NULL)
00137           error (EXIT_FAILURE, errno, "%s `%s'", file_write_error,
00138                  FILENAME_OUT);
00139 
00140       /* print both input source and output destination. */
00141       if (verbose)
00142         {
00143           fprintf (stderr, "(%s `%s')\n", input_file_msg,
00144                    (ifp != NULL) ? FILENAME_IN : stdin_msg);
00145           fprintf (stderr, "(%s `%s')\n", output_file_msg,
00146                    (ofp != NULL) ? FILENAME_OUT : stdout_msg);
00147 
00148           /* for the interface. */
00149           fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00150         }
00151 
00152       /* initialize the linked list. */
00153       list_a_ptr = init_list ();
00154 
00155       if (verbose)
00156         {
00157           if (ifp == NULL)
00158             fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", use_standard_input);
00159           else
00160             fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", use_file_input);
00161         }
00162 
00163       /* start fetching lines until EOF found. */
00164       while ((fgets (sentence, MAX_LINE, READ_SOURCE)) != NULL)
00165         {
00166           /* try to enter a new node. */
00167           enter_node = enter (list_a_ptr, sentence, ++max_lines);
00168 
00169           /* !ok fix the index in case `enter' return false. */
00170           if (!enter_node)
00171             --max_lines;
00172         }
00173 
00174       /* no lines have been read. the file is empty. */
00175       if (max_lines == 0)
00176         {
00177           if (ifp != NULL)
00178             {
00179               fprintf (stderr, "%s `%s'.\n", file_is_empty, FILENAME_IN);
00180 
00181               /* close input file pointer. */
00182               fclose (ifp);
00183             }
00184           else if (verbose)
00185             fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", found_eof);
00186 
00187           /* close and remove output file. */
00188           if (ofp != NULL)
00189             {
00190               fclose (ofp);
00191               unlink (FILENAME_OUT);
00192             }
00193 
00194           /* close randomness input file pointer. */
00195           fclose (rfp);
00196 
00197           /* free the linked list. */
00198           free (list_a_ptr);
00199 
00200           return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00201         }
00202 
00203       /* reading finished. */
00204       if (verbose)
00205         {
00206           fprintf (stderr, "\n%s\n\n", read_ok);
00207 
00208           if (ofp == NULL)
00209             fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", use_standard_output);
00210           else
00211             fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", use_file_output);
00212         }
00213 
00214       /* get a random integer between `1' and max_lines.
00215          use `print_line' to print the line which has
00216          the same index value as random_position. */
00217       while (loop_max > loop_min)
00218         {
00219           random_position = random_number (1, max_lines, FILENAME_RANDOM);
00220 
00221           if (verbose)
00222             fprintf (WRITE_DESTINATION, "(%s %d)\n", line_number_msg,
00223                      random_position);
00224 
00225           /* that may not happen. but, why we are so sure? */
00226           assert (random_position > 0);
00227 
00228           /* print the sentence. */
00229           if (verbose)
00230             fprintf (WRITE_DESTINATION, "  -> ");
00231 
00232           print_line (WRITE_DESTINATION, list_a_ptr, random_position);
00233 
00234           /* for the interface. */
00235           if (loop_max < 1)
00236             fprintf (WRITE_DESTINATION, "\n");
00237 
00238           --loop_max;
00239         }
00240 
00241       /* writing finished. */
00242       if (verbose)
00243         fprintf (stderr, "\n%s\n\n", write_ok);
00244 
00245       /* close all input/output data pointers. */
00246       if (ifp != NULL)
00247         fclose (ifp);
00248 
00249       if (ofp != NULL)
00250         fclose (ofp);
00251 
00252       /* close randomness file pointer. */
00253       fclose (rfp);
00254 
00255       /* free the linked list. */
00256       free_list (list_a_ptr);
00257     }
00258 
00259   return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00260 }
00261 
00262 /* the following function prints some
00263    usage information for the program. */
00264 static void
00265 print_usage (FILE * stream, cint exit_code)
00266 {
00267   fprintf (stream, "%s %s %s\n", usage_part_a, program_name, usage_part_b);
00268   fprintf (stream, "\n%s", usage_part_c);
00269   fprintf (stream, "%s\n", usage_part_d);
00270   fprintf (stream, "%s\n", usage_part_e);
00271   fprintf (stream, "%s\n", reportbugs_msg);
00272   exit (exit_code);
00273 }
00274 
00275 /* the following function parses the command line. */
00276 static void
00277 parse_options (int argc, char **argv)
00278 {
00279   register int next_option;
00280 
00281   /* short options. */
00282   unique short_options = "i:o:rva:";
00283 
00284   /* long options. */
00285   const struct option long_options[] = {
00286     {"input", 1, NULL, 'i'},
00287     {"output", 1, NULL, 'o'},
00288     {"high-randomness", 0, NULL, 'r'},
00289     {"verbose", 0, NULL, 'v'},
00290     {"again", 1, NULL, 'a'},
00291     {"help", 0, NULL, 'h'},
00292     {"usage", 0, NULL, 'u'},
00293     {"version", 0, NULL, 'V'},
00294     {NULL, 0, NULL, 0}
00295   };
00296 
00297   /* get the command program name. */
00298   program_name = program_invocation_short_name;
00299 
00300   /* fetch both input and output environment filenames. */
00301   environment_input = getenv ("GTRM_INPUT");
00302   environment_output = getenv ("GTRM_OUTPUT");
00303 
00304   /* start scanning. */
00305   do
00306     {
00307       /* get next option. */
00308       next_option =
00309         getopt_long (argc, argv, short_options, long_options, NULL);
00310 
00311       switch (next_option)
00312         {
00313           /* print usage and exit. */
00314         case 'h':
00315         case 'u':
00316           print_usage (stdout, EXIT_SUCCESS);
00317 
00318           /* print version and exit. */
00319         case 'V':
00320           printf ("%s %s\n", package_msg, version_msg);
00321           printf ("%s %s\n", writtenby_msg, developers_msg);
00322           printf ("\n%s", license_part_a);
00323           printf ("%s\n", license_part_b);
00324           printf ("%s\n", license_part_c);
00325           printf ("%s\n", reportbugs_msg);
00326           exit (EXIT_SUCCESS);
00327 
00328           /* get input filename. */
00329         case 'i':
00330           input_filename = strdup (optarg);
00331           break;
00332 
00333           /* get output filename. */
00334         case 'o':
00335           output_filename = strdup (optarg);
00336           break;
00337 
00338           /* enable high quality randomness. */
00339         case 'r':
00340           high_randomness = true;
00341           break;
00342 
00343           /* enable verbose mode. */
00344         case 'v':
00345           verbose = true;
00346           break;
00347 
00348           /* get how many times to repeat. */
00349         case 'a':
00350           {
00351             char *end;
00352 
00353             /* convert the argument to long. */
00354             loop_max = strtol (optarg, &end, 10);
00355 
00356             /* check to see if it is an integer. */
00357             if ((*end != '\0') || (loop_max <= 0))
00358               {
00359                 fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", loop_max_error_a);
00360                 fprintf (stderr, "  %s\n\n", loop_max_error_b);
00361                 print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00362               }
00363           }
00364           break;
00365 
00366           /* unknown option. */
00367         case '?':
00368           print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00369 
00370           /* eop. */
00371         case -1:
00372           break;
00373 
00374         default:
00375           abort ();
00376         }
00377     }
00378   while (next_option != -1);
00379 }
